result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard F. Madsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office in Neillsville upon receipt of this judgment if he has not previously reported.

miscConds.notes: Restitution and all other costs of the action paid from bond previously posted. Restitution was ordered Joint &Several with Jessica Scoville if convicted in this matter.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with the victims family or their place of residence/work of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted huber privileges and may serve sentence in Jackson County jail provided he has the approval of the Sheriff in each County. Jail sentence in 14CF126 and 14CF50 to served consecutively to each other with the sentence in 14CF126 to be served first.
Consecutive to:  Jail sentence in 14CF126 and 14CF50 to served consecutively to each other with the sentence in 14CF126 to be served first
